text: Joan Rosebud Blondell (August 30, 1906 â€“ December 25, 1979) was an American actress. She performed in movies and television for nearly fifty years.Matthew Kennedy, Joan Blondell: A Life Between Takes (Jackson: University Press of Mississippi, 2007), p. 3 She played Rosie Sturges in Kansas City Princess. She also played Gloria Fay in the movie Miss Pacific Fleet.Matthew Kennedy, Joan Blondell: A Life Between Takes (Jackson: University Press of Mississippi, 2007), p. 250 Blondell was born in New York City on August 30, 1906.Ray Hagen; Laura Wagner, Killer Tomatoes: Fifteen Tough Film Dames (Jefferson, NC: McFarland, 2004), p. 33 Her sister Gloria Blondell was also an actress. She died on December 25, 1979 in Santa Monica, California from leukemia.Paul Donnelley, Fade to Black: A Book of Movie Obituaries (London: Omnibus, 2003), p. 102 == References == Category:Actors from New York City Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:1906 births Category:1979 deaths
title: Joan Blondell
